sect1.title: Sesame
sect1.para: The RDFBean sesame module depends currently on Sesame 2.7.6. It is change from past where previous versions of RDFBean depended on Sesame 3.0 alpha.
Sessame 2.7 support is provided via the rdfbean-sesame2 module.
Sessame 3.0 alpha support is provided via the rdfbean-sesame3 module.
From version 1.7, RDFBean implements three main Sesame Repository backends : MemoryRepository, NativeRepository, HTTPRepository.

sect2.title: MemoryRepository
sect2.para: MemoryRepository is an Repository implementation wrapping the Sesame MemoryStore. The configuration options are the data dir for File based data persistence and sesameInference for turning on the Sesame level RDF Schema inference.

sect2.title: NativeRepository
sect2.para: NativeRepository wraps the Sesame NativeStore and has the mandatory configuration attribute dataDir for the location of the data directory and sesameInference for turning on Seame inference.
NativeRepository is slower for small amounts of triples than the MemoryRepository, but scales better with higher amounts of triples

sect2.title: HTTPRepository
sect2.para: HTTPRepository is an Repository implementation wrapping the Sesame HTTPRepository. This allow RDFBean users to use remote repositories like OWLIM etc.

sect2.title: Custom Sesame repository
sect2.para: To use other Sesame repositories or further customize the usage of MemoryStore and NativeStore create a subclass of AbstractSesameRepository.
